div.p: My greetings and willing service beforehand, venerable, faithful, dear godfather, today after the sermon, Captain Fridli Schüler comes to me and tells me how he understood from my brother-in-law, Captain Schiesser, that there are supposed to be 300 cavalry stationed in Geneva. Now I am curious about what and why they are there, with a request to write to you about this, so that you can give us a report on the situation there. I could not refuse him and also ask you to understand everything from me in the best way.
He also sends you very friendly greetings, as do my wife and all my household.
Dated the 25th of March, in the year 1572.
To the venerable Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, pastor at the Grossmünster in Zurich, his faithful dear lord and godfather, to his hands.
